result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A Melk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Christopher A Melk
parties.address: 14370 West Maylore Drive, New Berlin, WI 53151

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Release for work and school if enrolled in educational program.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
If revoked, court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Correction from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).
Court set restitution at ZERO.
Maintian full time employment, or to be enrolled in full time educatioanl program, or maintian part time employment and part time educational program.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant to the following restrictions: firearm possession; voting.

No unsupervised contact with the children under the age of 16 years.
No contact with the vicim or the victim's mother.

Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with all rules as set forth by probation agent.
Court finds no additional programming is necessary other than the programs that the defendant is currently participating in. Any additional programming to be at the discretion of the agent.

timeConds.notes: Imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Memorandum packet submitted by attorney Taylor received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Christopher A Melk in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defense counsel is requesting an adjournment in order to prepare a private sentencing memorandum as the employee in her office who usually prepares the memorandums has left the office. State does not object. Court finds the State has complied with victims rights legislation. Court grants defense request for adjournment. Discussion regarding the charge defendant pled to at the plea hearing. The incorrect statute was written on the plea forms, but the correct statute was referred to on the record. Defendant pled to charge as follows:

COUNT 1 as AMENDED- Physical Abuse of a Child, Recklessly Causing Bodily Harm, contrary to sec. 948.03(3)(b) Wis. Stats., a Class I Felony. 
Defense counsel made appropriate changes to the plea forms. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Letter on behalf of the defendant from Family Service of Waukesha indicating enrollment in the New Directions Group received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Victim Impact statement received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 as Amended-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Defense counsel requested adjourned sentencing date. Court vacated jury trial date of 7/16/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25. 

Filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Christopher A Melk in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State made oral motion to amend the charge. Defendant charged as follows:
As to COUNT 1: Physical Abuse of Child - Recklessly Causing Bodily Harm, contrary to sec. 948.03(3)(c) Wis. Stats., a Class I Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher A Melk in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel requests a projected plea date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 07/16/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher A Melk in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. State is still waiting for the receipt of medical records and has not submitted an offer to defense counsel. Any defense motions to be filed by 04/10/2014. If defense counsel files motion to suppress, Court expects counsel to be prepared to argue the motion at final pretrial date. Court ordered this matter set for jury trial and final pretrial. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-27-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher A Melk in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Christopher A. Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 25.
Clerk:  jms
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with E.L. (8/12/11).

Defendant Christopher A Melk in court with attorney Anne Jaspers.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25. Per Assistant District Attorney case should be scheduled in PE due to charged as sensitive crimes.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/27/2014 @ 1:30pm
